main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Midwest City, Oklahoma on 20th July 1958. The observation was made using ground-radar by a military source and lasted 2-3 minutes. The object was described as a radar ball, 200 to 300 feet in diameter, appearing and disappearing, and emitting heat waves. It appeared to be spinning and emitting heat waves, and the radar observation concluded it to be planet Jupiter, an astronomical observation.
interesting points: The UFO was observed using ground-radar by a military source, adding credibility to the sighting.
The object's unusual behavior included appearing and disappearing, emitting heat waves, and spinning.
The report concluded that the radar observation was actually of planet Jupiter, highlighting the challenge of identifying UFOs accurately.
The description of the object as a radar ball, emitting heat waves, and being 200 to 300 feet in diameter adds intrigue to the sighting.
Despite the unusual characteristics and the radar observation, the conclusion ultimately attributed the sighting to an astronomical observation of planet Jupiter.
sighted object: radar ball, 200 to 300 feet in diameter, emitting heat waves
witnesses: military source, Captain 33rd Air Division, Oklahoma City Air Force Station
